title: Domaine de Villargeau 2014 Sauvignon Blanc (Coteaux du Giennois)
description: Produced just north of Sancerre, this wine shares many of the fresh, lightly herbal characters of those wines, just on a smaller, softer scale. Fruity with lemon zest and crisp acidity, it is ready to drink now, though will be better from late 2016.

title: Septima 2013 Obra Malbec (Mendoza)
description: At first, this smells almost entirely of wood and stalky berry fruits; with time, it takes on a cedary quality but remains leathery, minty and rooty. On the palate this is grabby while stalky, briny flavors of herbal fruits end rustic minty and challenging.

title: Von Schleinitz 2014 Estate Dry Riesling (Mosel)
description: Vivacious notes of yellow plum and pear are shaded in tones of savory herb and earth in this dry light-bodied Riesling. Lemon and tart tangerine acidity jolt the midpalate into a brisk finish. Drink now.

title: Penelope Sanchez 2014 Red (Campo de Borja)
description: Heavy oak aromas rest forcefully on top of plum and black cherry scents. This is fresh and proper in feel, with dominant oaky graininess and medicinal berry flavors that finish woody like a plank.

title: Poças 2014 Coroa d'Ouro Branco White (Douro)
description: The wine is soft and smooth with yellow fruits and a light texture. It is ripe, generous balancing fruit against the rounded perfumed structure. The wine is ready to drink.

title: Valmiñor 2014 Albariño (Rías Baixas)
description: Match stick and sulfur notes fade into citrus and kiwi on an O.K. nose. Kind of late in its life already, this smells big and pulpy. Apple and bitter-melon flavors finish citrusy. Drink immediately.

title: Adega Cooperativa de Borba 2013 Senses Syrah (Alentejano)
description: While the wine is very ripe in character, it is also finely structured and generous while still keeping a sense of proportion. It is dense, full of blackberry jelly flavors that are balanced by a final burst of acidity. Drink now, although better from early 2017.

title: Chatom 2012 Sangiovese (Calaveras County)
description: Interesting and complex aromas suggest new oak, tea, leather and red cherry. Tangy cranberry flavors and a crisp feel in the mouth make this wine enjoyable in a lean style.

title: Cruz Alta 2012 Chairman's Blend Malbec-Cabernet Sauvignon-Syrah Red (Mendoza)
description: Aromas of cardamom and clove as well as heat make for a challenging nose. In the mouth, heavy fruit combined with chippy tannins create a clipped feel. Ripe berry flavors are a bit jumbled, with oaky spice notes stepping up. A flat chunky finish is missing skip in its stride. This is 85% Malbec with Cabernet Sauvignon and Syrah.

title: Day 2014 Crowley Station Vineyards Pinot Noir (Eola-Amity Hills)
description: There's a hint of a sweaty, earthy undertone in the nose, and this wine shows a fair amount of stem and earth flavors. Sour cherry fruit adds a lighter layer, with notes of cement and bark. It spent time in 11% new oak.

title: Domaine de Mirail 2014 Colombard (Côtes de Gascogne)
description: From vines in the northeast corner of the Gers, this wine is fruity, fragrant and crisply perfumed. It is light on the palate, dancing with fresh acidity and a lightly herbal character. Drink now.

title: Château Famaey 2014 Chevalier Famaey Malbec (Côtes du Lot)
description: This wine reflects a fruity, young and fresh style. It's packed with bright red fruits; a soft texture hints at minerality and great acidity. It's made to be drunk young, without any wood aging, so drink now and until 2017.

title: Bodegas Campante 2014 Viña Reboreda Godello (Ribeiro)
description: Straightforward peach, nectarine and apple aromas are fleshy, as is the palate, which puts out leesy creamy flavors of apple and green banana. A leesy, low-acid finish is plump and lacks follow through. Drink immediately.

title: Cartuxa 2014 EA Tinto Red (Alentejano)
description: Rounded, smooth and fruity, this is an attractive wine. With its light texture and acidity that balance the juicy black fruits, it is ripe while also poised. The aftertaste is fresh and fruity.

title: Casa Santos Lima 2014 Palha-Canas Branco White (Lisboa)
description: This is a ripe wine that includes Chardonnay and Viognier in its blend. It has yellow fruits that are cut with plenty of acidity. A cool, crisp element reminds that the vineyards are close to the ocean. The wine is ready to drink.

title: Casado Morales 2007 Gran Reserva  (Rioja)
description: Rubbery aromas of pencil eraser are also smoky and odd, with the suggestion of clove. In the mouth this is pinched at first, then more oaky and creamy, but also rubbery. Roasted plum and stewed berry flavors finish tannic, with latent berry and cherry notes.

title: Quinta Nova de Nossa Senhora do Carmo 2011 Unoaked Cuvée Red (Douro)
description: The aim of this wine presumably is to show off the fruit quality from the quinta. It does succeed, but at the expense of complexity and richness. So the wine is tight with tannins and edgy with a texture that is dry and firm. Give it another year until 2017 before drinking.
winery: Quinta Nova de Nossa Senhora do Carmo

title: Kitchen Sink NV Red (California)
description: A very pleasant cherry-raspberry aroma and similarly fruity flavors bring a lot of appeal to this light-bodied and not very tannic wine. It's smooth and easy to drink, with no rough edges.

title: Leonard Kreusch 2014 Estate Gewürztraminer (Rheinhessen)
description: While intense aromas of mango, honey and blossom are appealing, this unusually structured Gewürztraminer seems at the same time quite tart and caramelized. It's lithe and lean with moderate concentration of peach and tangerine flavors.

title: Livio Voghera 2011  Barbera d'Alba Superiore
description: Aromas of baked plum, charred earth, melted chocolate and Asian spice lead the nose. The evolved, extracted palate offers raisin, a hint of exotic spice and a green note of powdered sage that leaves an astringent finish. This has seen better days so drink soon.

title: Magnum Vinhos 2014 Maria Mora Branco White (Alentejano)
description: A blend of Arinto and Antão Vaz, this is refreshingly fruity. It has pineapple as well as citrus flavors, an attractive blend of freshness and crispness. The aftertaste is bright, full of lively acidity.

title: Gary Farrell 2013 100% Skin Fermented Chardonnay (Russian River Valley)
description: Very little of this bottling was made. It's an experiment in making a white wine the way one would a red, fermented with skins and seeds, then aged eight months in new French oak. It's not for everyone. Cloudy and funky, it's teeming with acidity and yet somewhat dense on the palate, the fruit muted in favor of a taste of flowers and clay.

title: Louis Max 2014 Beaucharme  (Bourgogne)
description: This is a refreshing, lemon-flavored wine. Attractive crispness comes out of the mineral texture and perfumed acidity. Light and still young, this will age to be ready to drink from late 2016.

title: Louis Max 2014  Mâcon-Villages
description: Ripe yellow fruits dominate this full wine. Balanced by apple freshness, it offers rich apricots and creamed pear, backed by acidity. It's simple, fruity and delicious now.

title: Francis Ford Coppola 2013 Director's Cut Chardonnay (Russian River Valley)
description: This ripe wine is intense and full bodied, with sultry layers of baked apple and peach. A flinty note marks the finish.

title: Grayson 2014 Lot 5 Pinot Noir (California)
description: This agreeable and affordable wine has cinnamon and cherry jelly aromas, fresh and light fruit flavors, medium body, and a soft texture.

title: Husch 2014 Chenin Blanc (Mendocino)
description: This wine will be ideal for picnics, or to bring a little summer to the cocktail hour in the cold months. It smells like fresh-cut apples, tastes deliciously fruity and has crispness rounded off by a dash of sweetness.

title: Il Falchetto 2014 Pian Scorrone  (Barbera d'Asti)
description: Fresh and easygoing, this bright red opens with subdued aromas of red berry and a whiff of cooking spice. The lively, informal palate offers black cherry, ground pepper and a hint of anise alongside brisk acidity.

title: Nora 2014 Peitán Albariño (Rías Baixas)
description: Aromas of ocean breeze and white clover are raw but good. This feels round, pulpy and citrusy, with green slightly bitter flavors of citrus, honey and brine. Acidity plays a big role in keeping this afloat. Drink immediately.

title: Ocaso 2014 Malbec (Mendoza)
description: Light scratchy aromas of spiced plum and raspberry set up a racy lean palate that nobody would label as heavy. Quick simple flavors of red plum and red currant finish tangy but mild.
